title: Consider optimisation of binary storage to minimise storage space for non-active versions
description:
# bm-01p Implementation Plan

## Problem summary
`binmate` currently keeps extracted binaries for every installed version under `~/.local/share/binmate/versions/<binary>/<version>/...`, which can consume significant disk space.  
For bm-01p, we will move to **archive-only storage for non-active versions**, keeping only the active version extracted and re-extracting on switch.

## Current state analysis
- `internal/core/install/service.go` always downloads + extracts during install, then stores `installations.installed_path` as the extracted binary path.
- `internal/core/version/service.go` switches by symlinking to `installation.InstalledPath` and assumes the target exists.
- `internal/providers/github/download_asset.go` saves archives in cache (`os.UserCacheDir()/binmate/...`) but this cache is not integrated into install/switch workflows.
- `downloads` table/repository exists (`internal/database/schema.go`, `internal/database/repository/downloads.go`) but is currently unused by core install/switch logic.
- Remove flow (`internal/core/binary/service.go`) deletes installation paths, but does not manage archive cache records/files.

## Confirmed behavioural decisions
- ✅ Non-active versions should be archive-only.
- ✅ On every install/switch, keep exactly one extracted version (the active one).
- ✅ If archive cache is missing during switch, automatically re-download from GitHub.

## Workplan
- [ ] Add a storage orchestration layer for version materialisation.
  - [ ] Introduce helper(s) to: locate active/inactive installations, ensure archive availability, extract a target version, and clean extracted files of inactive versions.
  - [ ] Reuse existing extraction functions (`ExtractAsset`) and avoid duplicate extraction logic.
- [ ] Wire install flow to persist archive metadata and enforce single extracted active version.
  - [ ] After successful download, upsert/create `downloads` record with cache path for `(binary_id, version)`.
  - [ ] Keep installed version extracted and set active symlink as today.
  - [ ] Remove extracted files for all other installed versions (preserving DB records and archives).
  - [ ] Ensure `installations.installed_path` is updated if extraction location changes during rematerialisation.
- [ ] Wire switch flow to extract on demand before symlink update.
  - [ ] On switch, verify `installation.InstalledPath` exists.
  - [ ] If missing, restore from cached archive; if archive missing, fetch release asset + download, then extract.
  - [ ] Update installation record path/checksum/size metadata if rematerialised output differs.
  - [ ] Set active symlink and prune extracted files for all now-inactive versions.
- [ ] Add repository support needed for safe metadata updates.
  - [ ] Add/update methods for installation path and metadata updates (minimal SQL changes).
  - [ ] Add helper for download lookup/create-or-update by `(binary_id, version)` if needed.
- [ ] Extend tests for new behaviour.
  - [ ] Unit tests for “switch rematerialises missing extracted binary”.
  - [ ] Unit tests for “install prunes inactive extracted versions”.
  - [ ] Unit tests for “switch re-downloads when archive missing”.
  - [ ] Regression checks for symlink correctness and non-circular targets.
- [ ] Update user-facing docs/help where storage semantics are described (README and/or relevant command docs) to explain archive-only inactive versions.
- [ ] Validate quality gates.
  - [ ] Run `go test ./...` and ensure touched packages pass.
  - [ ] Run `go fmt` on changed Go files.

## Notes and considerations
- Keep changes surgical: reuse existing DB tables (`downloads`) and service boundaries before adding new schema.
- Preserve current CLI UX and command contracts (`install`, `switch`, `versions`, `remove`).
- Ensure failures are explicit (no silent fallbacks), especially around missing archives and download/extraction errors.
- Prefer deterministic cache-path handling to avoid archive filename collisions across binaries/providers.
notes:

2) Wire install flow to persist archive metadata in downloads and prune inactive extracted files.
3) Wire switch flow to rematerialise missing extracted binaries from cache, with re-download fallback.
4) Add minimal repository support for safe metadata/path updates where needed.
5) Add tests for rematerialisation, pruning, and re-download fallback.
6) Update user-facing docs describing archive-only inactive versions.
7) Run gofmt and full go test validation.

title: GoReleaser changelog SHA suppression and PR links
description:
# Implementation Plan: GoReleaser changelog SHA suppression and PR links

## Problem and proposed approach
GoReleaser-generated release notes currently include a full commit SHA prefix in changelog entries, and PR references like `(#123)` are not rendered as links in the release UI.  
We will update `.goreleaser.yml` to use an explicit `changelog.format` template that removes the SHA and rewrites PR references to Markdown links while keeping PR/author metadata where possible, then validate output with a local snapshot release.

## Current state analysis
- `.goreleaser.yml` uses:
  - `changelog.use: github`
  - changelog filters and groups (`Features`, `Bug Fixes`, `Others`)
  - no explicit `changelog.format`
- With the current defaults, generated entries can include full commit SHAs.
- `release.mode: append` with custom header/footer is already configured and should remain unchanged.
- Requirement confirmed:
  - Remove SHA entirely (not shorten).
  - Keep PR/author metadata where possible.
  - Convert `(#123)` references into clickable links to the repository PR URL.

## Workplan
- [ ] Define changelog output format in `.goreleaser.yml`
  - [ ] Add `changelog.format` to exclude SHA from each entry.
  - [ ] Rewrite `(#123)` patterns to Markdown PR links (for this repository).
  - [ ] Preserve useful metadata (PR/author) in the formatted output where available.
  - [ ] Keep existing changelog grouping/filter logic unchanged.
- [ ] Validate generated release notes
  - [ ] Run GoReleaser snapshot release generation to inspect output.
  - [ ] Confirm changelog entries no longer include full SHA prefixes.
  - [ ] Confirm PR references render as clickable links in Markdown output.
  - [ ] Confirm grouping/filtering still works as before.
- [ ] Update release documentation (if needed)
  - [ ] Add/adjust a short note in `RELEASING.md` to reflect custom changelog formatting.
- [ ] Verify and finalise
  - [ ] Run relevant checks for the changed release config.
  - [ ] Capture a before/after sample entry in the final summary.

## Notes
- GoReleaser supports template-based formatting, so this should be a config-only change.
- If metadata fields differ for GitHub changelog entries, adjust template fields to keep the best available context without SHA.

title: Add version info command
description:
# bm-9t4 implementation plan: add version info command

## Problem and proposed approach

`bm-9t4` asks for a version info command.  
Current state:
- GoReleaser already injects build metadata via linker flags in `.goreleaser.yml`:
  - `-X main.version={{.Version}}`
  - `-X main.commit={{.Commit}}`
  - `-X main.date={{.Date}}`
- `main.go` currently has no exported build metadata variables, so there is no runtime surface to display this information.
- The CLI currently has no app-level `version` command or root `--version` behaviour.

Agreed scope:
- Support both `binmate version` (with alias `v`) and `binmate --version` (with shorthand `-v`).
- Default output is a short single-line version.
- Add verbose output for detailed metadata.
- Use `runtime/debug.ReadBuildInfo` fallback when linker-injected values are not present in local builds.

## Planning progress

- [x] Scope and behavioural decisions confirmed with user
- [x] bm-9t4 updated in beads with this implementation plan and moved to `in_progress`
- [ ] Implementation not started yet (plan mode only)

## Workplan

- [ ] Add central build metadata variables and resolver
  - [ ] Define `version`, `commit`, and `date` defaults in `main` package for linker injection.
  - [ ] Add a small resolver helper that:
    - [ ] Prioritises linker-injected values.
    - [ ] Falls back to `debug.ReadBuildInfo` (`vcs.revision`, `vcs.time`, `vcs.modified`) when available.
    - [ ] Normalises empty values to safe defaults (`dev`, `unknown`).
- [ ] Add CLI surfaces for version output
  - [ ] Implement `internal/cli/version` command:
    - [ ] Default short output (`binmate <version>`).
    - [ ] `--verbose` output with commit/date (+ VCS modified state where available).
    - [ ] Optional `--short` if needed for explicit machine-friendly output symmetry.
  - [ ] Wire command into `cmd/main.go`.
  - [ ] Enable root `--version` behaviour with the same short-format output.
- [ ] Keep behaviour and conventions consistent
  - [ ] Ensure output writes to `cmd.OutOrStdout()` and errors are wrapped idiomatically.
  - [ ] Keep formatting stable for scripting.
- [ ] Add/extend tests
  - [ ] Unit tests for metadata resolution logic (linker values, build-info fallback, unknown defaults).
  - [ ] Command tests for:
    - [ ] `version` short output.
    - [ ] `version --verbose`.
    - [ ] Root `--version`.
- [ ] Documentation updates
  - [ ] Update `README.md` usage examples with `binmate version` and `binmate --version`.
  - [ ] Optional note in `RELEASING.md` that release builds embed version/commit/date via linker flags.
- [ ] Validation
  - [ ] Run `go test ./...`.
  - [ ] Run a local build and smoke-check:
    - [ ] `go build -o /tmp/binmate .`
    - [ ] `/tmp/binmate --version`
    - [ ] `/tmp/binmate version --verbose`

## Common Go conventions for build metadata injection

- Use linker flags (`-ldflags "-X package.var=value"`) for release version/commit/date.
- Keep defaults in code for local dev builds (`dev`, `unknown`), then override in CI/release builds.
- Prefer one canonical metadata resolver used by all command surfaces.
- Use `runtime/debug.ReadBuildInfo` as a fallback for VCS metadata in non-release builds.
- Keep default `--version` output short and stable for scripts; provide verbose/human-friendly detail via an explicit flag or subcommand.

title: Migrate from mattn/go-sqlite3 to modernc.org/sqlite to eliminate CGO
description:
## Summary

Replace `mattn/go-sqlite3` (CGO-based) with `modernc.org/sqlite` (pure Go) to eliminate the CGO dependency and simplify cross-platform builds.

## Background

The release workflow (GitHub Actions) currently fails when building for macOS targets because `mattn/go-sqlite3` requires CGO, which in turn requires Zig as a cross-compiler. Zig cannot resolve `libresolv` during macOS cross-compilation from a Linux runner (see [ziglang/zig#16674](https://github.com/ziglang/zig/issues/16674)).

A workaround exists (`CGO_LDFLAGS=-Wl,-undefined,dynamic_lookup`), but it disables linker safety checks for the entire binary. This approach is fragile, unproven at scale, and no major Go projects ship `mattn/go-sqlite3` with Zig cross-compilation to macOS/Windows.

## Scope

### Go Code Changes
- Replace `github.com/mattn/go-sqlite3` with `modernc.org/sqlite` in `go.mod`
- Update the driver import in `internal/database/connection.go` from `_ "github.com/mattn/go-sqlite3"` to `_ "modernc.org/sqlite"`
- Update `sql.Open("sqlite3", ...)` to use the modernc driver name if different
- Run all existing database tests to verify compatibility

### GoReleaser Changes (`.goreleaser.yml`)
- Remove `CGO_ENABLED=1` from build env
- Remove all platform-specific `overrides` (Zig CC targets, CGO_LDFLAGS)

### CI/CD Changes (`.github/workflows/release.yml`)
- Remove the `Install cross-compilation tools` step (Zig installation)

### Testing
- Verify all existing database tests pass (`go test ./internal/database/...`)
- Verify full test suite passes (`go test ./...`)
- Verify GoReleaser snapshot build succeeds locally (`goreleaser build --snapshot --clean`)
- Test the built binary on macOS and Windows if possible

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `modernc.org/sqlite` replaces `mattn/go-sqlite3` as the SQLite driver
- [ ] CGO is no longer required for any build target
- [ ] Zig is no longer required in the CI/CD pipeline
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] Release workflow builds successfully for all 6 targets (linux/darwin/windows × amd64/arm64)
- [ ] No `CGO_LDFLAGS` workarounds in the GoReleaser config

## Risks
- **Performance**: `modernc.org/sqlite` is ~2x slower on inserts and 10-100% slower on queries vs `mattn/go-sqlite3`. This is negligible for binmate's use case (small CRUD operations for tracking installed binaries).
- **Compatibility**: `modernc.org/sqlite` passes most but not all SQLite test suite cases. Edge-case bugs are possible but unlikely for standard operations.
- **API differences**: The `database/sql` interface is the same; only the driver import and registration name may differ.

title: Move help rendering out of placeholders file
Fix symbolic link error when switching to new version with multiple installs
description:
When multiple versions are available for a binary, switching to a different version leads to the following error:

```
zsh: too many levels of symbolic links: bun
```

Comparing the symlink paths between two different binaries shows the following:

```
lrwxrwxrwx 1 vscode vscode   61 Feb  8 16:21 bat -> /home/vscode/.local/share/binmate/versions/batcat/v0.22.0/bat
lrwxrwxrwx 1 vscode vscode   27 Feb  8 16:25 bun -> /home/vscode/.local/bin/bun
```

The first result (`bat`) was generated from installing a new version. The second (`bun`) was generated from switching to an existing install version.

```
binmate import /usr/local/bin/gh --url https://github.com/cli/cli/releases/download/v2.30.0/gh_2.30.0_linux_amd64.tar.gz --version v2.30.0-custom
```

Implementation notes:
- Invoke the binmate binary from its installation path directly in case required `PATH` is not in place. For example, if installed to `/usr/local/bin/binmate`, run `/usr/local/bin/binmate import`
- Similarly, the import path argument should point to the actual installed location based on user preference (either default of user home or `/usr/local/bin`)
- Provide the `--url` flag using the resolved release asset download URL
- Provide the `--version` flag using the resolved version tag

When importing an existing binary and using the `keepLocation` flag, it sets up a redundant symlink for the same path.

See the import command in `install.sh` for example usage that leads to this behaviour.
close_reason: Skip symlink creation for keep-location imports

title: Implement binary alias override functionality
description: The Binary struct in internal/core/config/config.go has an Alias field that should allow overriding the binary name used for symlinks. Currently marked as TODO. Need to implement this in the version management code (set_active_version.go) to use the alias instead of the name when creating symlinks.

title: Add github actions unit test workflow
Complete uninstall functionality - delete physical files and symlinks
description: The Uninstall method in internal/core/binary/service.go currently only removes database records but does not delete the physical files and symlinks when removeFiles is true. This creates disk space leaks. Need to implement file/symlink deletion for installed versions at the configured install path.

title: Add view release notes action to available versions view
description:
The view release notes action should be present in the available versions view for a binary.

Also, the view release notes view should be updated to add wrapping/text overflow to avoid taking up more space than is available.

title: Implement binary import functionality
description:
The ImportBinary method in internal/core/binary/service.go is currently a stub. 

Need to implement functionality to import existing binaries into binmate management. This should: 
	1) Detect binary location and version, 
	2) Create database record, 
	3) Optionally move to managed location, 
	4) Create symlinks. 

See .github/plan.md Phase 5 for requirements.

Import functionality should be available in both CLI and TUI.

title: Add test coverage for config package (9.3% coverage)
description: The internal/core/config package has only 9.3% coverage. Config parsing is essential for app functionality. Need tests for: ReadConfig(), GetBinary(). Test valid/invalid config.json, missing files, malformed JSON, schema validation. Only SyncToDatabase currently has tests. Target: >80% coverage.

title: Implement cross-platform path handling for Windows
description:
The database connection in internal/database/connection.go uses hardcoded .local/share path which doesn't work on Windows. Need to implement OS-aware path resolution that uses appropriate directories for Linux/macOS/Windows. Consider using go-appdir or similar library for XDG Base Directory specification compliance.

A similar approach could be used as has been implemented in the `getInstallBinPath` function in `internal/core/version/get_install_bin_path.go` where it explicitly checks if the platform is windows.
